# Government Tender Announcement
## Project Management Services (TSPS) - Senior Project Leader/Executive
### Request for Proposal (RFP)
#### Competition Number: W847A-240392
#### Date: December 20, 2023
#### Closing Date: January 11, 2024 (15:00:00)

### Background
The Department of National Defence (DND) and Canadian Armed Forces (CAF) require expertise in project management to implement the Future Aircrew Training (FAcT) program. The requirement is for a senior project leader/executive to provide advice, recommendations, planning, and policy support in the area of implementation of performance-based contracts within the Government of Canada, airworthiness policies, ground-based training systems design, and in-service support.

### Objectives
The objectives of this requirement are to:

* Ensure timely and dedicated expertise to complete necessary and specialized work for the FAcT program
* Provide advice, recommendations, planning, and policy support in the areas of implementation of performance-based contracts, airworthiness policies, ground-based training systems design, and in-service support

### Method of Supply
This requirement will be awarded based on a competitive process. The requirement is subject to the provisions of the World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO-AGP), the Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA), the Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement (CPFTA), the Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement (CColFTA), the Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement (CPanFTA), the Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA), Canada Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA), and the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA).

### Evaluation Criteria
The proposal will be evaluated on the following criteria:

* Technical Merit (40%)
* Price (30%)
* Past Performance (30%)

### Contract Period
The proposed contract period is from February 1, 2024, to January 31, 2026, with an estimated level of effort of 240 days per resource.

### Contracting Authority
The contracting authority is Andrew McMillan, who can be contacted at (343) 574-1876 or [andrew.mcmillan@forces.gc.ca](mailto:andrew.mcmillan@forces.gc.ca).

### Trade Agreements
The requirement is subject to the provisions of the following trade agreements:

* World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO-AGP)
* Canada-Chile Free
